(a) Any violation of this chapter is both a civil offense and a misdemeanor criminal offense. The fine for a criminal violation of this chapter shall be up to five hundred dollars ($500.00) or larger if allowed by G.S. 14-4. Misdemeanor violations shall be enforced by the issuance of citations or by arrest according to the same procedures used for other criminal violations.(b) The first violation of this chapter shall subject the violator to a civil penalty of fifty dollars ($50.00); the second violation during a twelve-month period shall be subject to a one hundred dollar ($100.00) penalty; the third and subsequent violations shall be subject to a one hundred fifty dollar ($150.00) penalty. Notwithstanding this schedule of penalties, the fourth and subsequent violations of §12-3021 et seq. of this chapter (Public Nuisance Animals) shall subject the violator to a two hundred fifty dollar ($250.00) penalty. Civil citations shall be served personally upon the violator by the animal control officer, by a member of the Raleigh Police Department, or by any other means authorized for the service of civil process by the North Carolina Rules of Civil Procedure.(c) Failure to pay any license fee established by this chapter will constitute both a civil offense and a criminal misdemeanor. The violator will be subject to the amount of the license fee in addition to the civil and criminal penalties set out in subsection (b) above. A civil collection of the fee will be in the nature of a collection for debt. 
(Ord. No. 2003-433, §2, 4-15-03) 
Editor’s note— 
Ord. No. 2003-433, §1, adopted April 15, 2003, repealed the former §12-3069 which pertained to license tax deemed a debt to City, liability for tax and penalty, and action to recover moneys, and derived from Code 1959, § 4-43; Ord. No. 1977-615, §1, adopted Sept. 6, 1977; and Ord. No. 1984-307, §5, adopted March 20, 1984. Section 2 of Ord. No. 2003-433 enacted a new §12-3069 as set out herein.

CODE OF STATE

FINES AND PENALTIES. (§ 12-3069)

(a) Any violation of this chapter is both a civil offense and a misdemeanor
criminal offense. The fine for a criminal violation of this chapter shall be up
to five hundred dollars ($500.00) or larger if allowed by G.S. 14-4. Misdemeanor
violations shall be enforced by the issuance of citations or by arrest according
to the same procedures used for other criminal violations.

(b) The first violation of this chapter shall subject the violator to a civil
penalty of fifty dollars ($50.00); the second violation during a twelve-month
period shall be subject to a one hundred dollar ($100.00) penalty; the third and
subsequent violations shall be subject to a one hundred fifty dollar ($150.00)
penalty. Notwithstanding this schedule of penalties, the fourth and subsequent
violations of §12-3021 et seq. of this chapter (Public Nuisance Animals) shall
subject the violator to a two hundred fifty dollar ($250.00) penalty. Civil
citations shall be served personally upon the violator by the animal control
officer, by a member of the Raleigh Police Department, or by any other means
authorized for the service of civil process by the North Carolina Rules of Civil
Procedure.

(c) Failure to pay any license fee established by this chapter will constitute
both a civil offense and a criminal misdemeanor. The violator will be subject to
the amount of the license fee in addition to the civil and criminal penalties
set out in subsection (b) above. A civil collection of the fee will be in the
nature of a collection for debt. 
(Ord. No. 2003-433, §2, 4-15-03)

which pertained to license tax deemed a debt to City, liability for tax and

No. 1977-615, §1, adopted Sept. 6, 1977; and Ord. No. 1984-307, §5, adopted

out herein.
